title: German police fatally shoot gunman near Israeli Consulate in Munich
content: The attacker fired several shots near the Israeli Consulate and was killed by police. The incident happened on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.
summary: The attacker fired several shots near the Israeli Consulate and was killed by police. The incident happened on the anniversary of the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre.

title: Ukraine set to tap former ambassador Andrii Sybiha as top diplomat
content: The replacement of prominent Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba comes amid a wide-ranging government reshuffle ahead of the president’s trip to the United States.
summary: The replacement of prominent Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba comes amid a wide-ranging government reshuffle ahead of the president’s trip to the United States.

title: New Zealand’s Maori celebrate new era as 27-year-old queen is anointed
content: Nga Wai Hono i te Po Paki takes on the ceremonial role amid heightened tensions with the conservative government, which is rolling back “race-based” policies.
summary: Nga Wai Hono i te Po Paki takes on the ceremonial role amid heightened tensions with the conservative government, which is rolling back “race-based” policies.

title: Blinken to visit Haiti in a show of U.S. support for new government
content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip to Haiti comes amid concerns that a policing mission has struggled to dent the country’s gang violence.
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip to Haiti comes amid concerns that a policing mission has struggled to dent the country’s gang violence.

title: Ugandan Olympic runner dies after being set on fire by boyfriend
content: Rebecca Cheptegei is the third athlete to be killed by a partner in a domestic violence incident in Kenya.
summary: Rebecca Cheptegei is the third athlete to be killed by a partner in a domestic violence incident in Kenya.

title: A tax on tourism? To visit these destinations, it’ll cost you extra.
content: New Zealand announced it is nearly tripling its tourist tax, joining places from Venice to Bali, Indonesia, that are trying to offset overtourism.
summary: New Zealand announced it is nearly tripling its tourist tax, joining places from Venice to Bali, Indonesia, that are trying to offset overtourism.

title: China pledges $50B and 1M jobs in renewed outreach to Africa
content: Chinese leader Xi Jinping, seeking contrast with Washington, said Beijing offered Africa modernization without Western-style “suffering.”
summary: Chinese leader Xi Jinping, seeking contrast with Washington, said Beijing offered Africa modernization without Western-style “suffering.”

title: Hostage killings and irreconcilable demands complicate cease-fire talks
content: Frustrated mediators are now putting together what they have described as a “final offer,” but significant concessions on both sides are needed for agreement, said a U.S. official.
summary: Frustrated mediators are now putting together what they have described as a “final offer,” but significant concessions on both sides are needed for agreement, said a U.S. official.

title: Venezuela detains U.S. sailor, officials say
content: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.
summary: The incident occurred amid an increasingly adversarial relationship between Washington and Caracas.

title: The Philadelphi Corridor, an Israel-Gaza cease-fire obstacle, explained
content: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.
summary: Israel’s demand to control the Philadelphi Corridor — a narrow strip of no man’s land — is a key issue in Gaza cease-fire talks.

title: Netanyahu’s conflicting messages confuse cease-fire talks, officials say
content: Netanyahu this week said Israel would not withdraw from the Gaza-Egypt border, while his chief negotiator told mediators the military would eventually pull out.
summary: Netanyahu this week said Israel would not withdraw from the Gaza-Egypt border, while his chief negotiator told mediators the military would eventually pull out.

title: Breakdancer Raygun responds to backlash after infamous Olympic performance
content: The Australian academic said she has struggled with her mental health and worried about her and her loved ones’ safety, but that dancing remains her “medicine.”
summary: The Australian academic said she has struggled with her mental health and worried about her and her loved ones’ safety, but that dancing remains her “medicine.”

title: All 72 deaths in U.K.’s Grenfell Tower fire avoidable, final report says
content: The burning of Grenfell Tower and the deaths of dozens horrified Britain and put renewed scrutiny on building codes and safety measures.
summary: The burning of Grenfell Tower and the deaths of dozens horrified Britain and put renewed scrutiny on building codes and safety measures.

title: Zelensky reshuffles cabinet at key moment in war and ahead of U.S. trip
content: The reorganization of the administration comes as Russia unleashes a new wave of aerial attacks on Ukrainian cities, including one on Lviv that killed seven overnight.
summary: The reorganization of the administration comes as Russia unleashes a new wave of aerial attacks on Ukrainian cities, including one on Lviv that killed seven overnight.

title: Why everyone is suddenly worried about Mexico’s democracy
content: President Andres Manuel López Obrador, in his final month in office, is pushing legislation that would send appointed federal judges home and let voters elect their replacements.
summary: President Andres Manuel López Obrador, in his final month in office, is pushing legislation that would send appointed federal judges home and let voters elect their replacements.

title: Spanish singles found a new dating strategy. It’s in the fruit aisle.
content: The method, which grew popular on TikTok, involves placing a pineapple in your cart at the Mercadona grocery store at night. People say it’s a reaction against dating apps.
summary: The method, which grew popular on TikTok, involves placing a pineapple in your cart at the Mercadona grocery store at night. People say it’s a reaction against dating apps.

title: Which countries have suspended or restricted arms sales to Israel?
content: The U.K. is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.
summary: The U.K. is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.

title: Back to school in Ukraine’s embattled Kharkiv means heading underground
content: After years of distance learning, Kharkiv’s students finally get back to school — in a purpose built underground bunker safe from the Russian drones and missiles.
summary: After years of distance learning, Kharkiv’s students finally get back to school — in a purpose built underground bunker safe from the Russian drones and missiles.

title: Elton John recovering from vision loss in one eye after severe infection
content: The 77-year-old singer said he is “feeling positive” about the progress he has made, but it will take some time before sight returns to one eye.
summary: The 77-year-old singer said he is “feeling positive” about the progress he has made, but it will take some time before sight returns to one eye.

title: Netanyahu still wants more war
content: The Israeli leader’s critics argue he would rather prolong the war to assuage his far-right allies (and keep hold of power) than clinch a deal that stops hostilities and frees the remaining hostages.
summary: The Israeli leader’s critics argue he would rather prolong the war to assuage his far-right allies (and keep hold of power) than clinch a deal that stops hostilities and frees the remaining hostages.

title: No X in Brazil? No problem, Brazilians say.
content: The platform formerly known as Twitter once dominated Brazilian social media, fueling nationwide protests in 2013 and propelling Jair Bolsonaro to the presidency. Less so, now.
summary: The platform formerly known as Twitter once dominated Brazilian social media, fueling nationwide protests in 2013 and propelling Jair Bolsonaro to the presidency. Less so, now.

title: More than 50 killed in Russian missile strike on Ukrainian city of Poltava
content: Two missiles hit a military educational institution and nearby hospital. President Volodymyr Zelensky called for lifting restrictions on Western-supplied weapons.
summary: Two missiles hit a military educational institution and nearby hospital. President Volodymyr Zelensky called for lifting restrictions on Western-supplied weapons.

title: Former aide to N.Y. governors charged with secretly helping China
content: Linda Sun and her husband, Chris Hu, are accused of accepting millions of dollars in kickbacks in exchange for pushing political actions to benefit China.
summary: Linda Sun and her husband, Chris Hu, are accused of accepting millions of dollars in kickbacks in exchange for pushing political actions to benefit China.

title: As U.S. readies last cease-fire push, Netanyahu digs in on border demands
content: The Israeli prime minister’s insistence that troops stay in the Philadelphi Corridor along the Gaza-Egypt border is scuttling chances of a deal, officials say.
summary: The Israeli prime minister’s insistence that troops stay in the Philadelphi Corridor along the Gaza-Egypt border is scuttling chances of a deal, officials say.

title: Lebanon detains former central bank governor accused of financial crimes
content: Riad Salameh, who was once credited with reviving Lebanon’s post-civil-war economy, has since been blamed for the stunning collapse of its banking sector.
summary: Riad Salameh, who was once credited with reviving Lebanon’s post-civil-war economy, has since been blamed for the stunning collapse of its banking sector.

title: U.K. defends decision to restrict arms to Israel; Netanyahu calls it shameful
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the decision to halt 30 of 350 arms export licenses was “shameful,” while Amnesty International called it insufficient.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the decision to halt 30 of 350 arms export licenses was “shameful,” while Amnesty International called it insufficient.

title: Husband drugged wife, recruited over 70 men to rape her, prosecutors say
content: The case of Dominique Pélicot, accused of repeatedly sedating his wife and inviting men to rape her while she was unconscious, has caused outrage in France.
summary: The case of Dominique Pélicot, accused of repeatedly sedating his wife and inviting men to rape her while she was unconscious, has caused outrage in France.

title: Venezuela orders arrest of candidate who U.S., others say won election
content: Venezuela’s public prosecutor’s office accused opposition candidate Edmundo González of usurpation and instigating disobedience, among other crimes.
summary: Venezuela’s public prosecutor’s office accused opposition candidate Edmundo González of usurpation and instigating disobedience, among other crimes.

title: 12 dead after migrant boat in English Channel capsizes
content: A boat carrying dozens of migrants capsized in the English Channel off the coast of northern France. At least two people are missing.
summary: A boat carrying dozens of migrants capsized in the English Channel off the coast of northern France. At least two people are missing.

title: Anger over Oasis ticket prices sparks U.K. review of dynamic pricing
content: Delight at the Oasis reunion turned to outrage when fans found the pricing model meant some tickets had more than doubled in price while they queued online.
summary: Delight at the Oasis reunion turned to outrage when fans found the pricing model meant some tickets had more than doubled in price while they queued online.

title: Harry Potter fans boo as ‘miserable muggles’ nix annual King’s Cross event
content: The train station in London canceled its annual “Back to Hogwarts” tradition, a public announcement that the Hogwarts Express was ready to depart.
summary: The train station in London canceled its annual “Back to Hogwarts” tradition, a public announcement that the Hogwarts Express was ready to depart.

title: More than 100 killed in failed Congo jail break at overcrowded prison
content: The prison in the Congolese capital, Kinshasa, was notorious for its overcrowding, with conditions described by Amnesty International as “appalling.”
summary: The prison in the Congolese capital, Kinshasa, was notorious for its overcrowding, with conditions described by Amnesty International as “appalling.”
